text: I rented a pontoon boat for the afternoon this past Saturday.  Form my initial call to ask about availability to our successful rental and return of the boat, the experience was seamless. name: E Sugar
text:
Bought a Yamaha outboard from Cathouse Marine.  I had a great experience in the beginning  w/ Steve/Dee but the outboard was damaged in transportation back in February 2021.  I was told that everything would be resolved. Sadly the owner became ill and I backed off.  I’m sorry for their loss, but several months later I still have a damaged motor w/ no resolution  from the transporter or seller. 🤷‍♂️ Seasonal boating & half way through summer and haven’t used it.  Disappointing to say the least, hope they do the right thing.

8/11/21 I wanted to change my review, because Dee came through and took care of what was promised.  I know they were going through some family struggles but glad they kept their word.  All the best

name: Matthew Pipkin
text: I can't say enough good things about this business I have used them before and will always be my go to marine uses. They installed twin outboards for me on my boat in only 3 short weeks and everything worked as they said it would. They didn't try and sell me a bunch of mess that I didn't need they called and asked before anything was ordered and installed. They where very upfront and honest on all things up front. That that's the way it should be. So if you have any boats needs around Central Alabama come see Cathouse marine and they too will that you like family

name: Lucas Lee
text: Brought my 2002 boat in with a 40 HP Mariner. (Nothing fancy at all). The boat would plane off but lose power almost immediately. They replaced power pack with a used one they robbed from another motor and said it was fixed. I was skeptical because I had just replaced the power packs a month before. Put it in the water and still doing the same thing. Took it back to them. After it sat there for 3 weeks I called and could not get an answer. Drove by there and a sign on the door saying "closed due to covid will reopen on said date". The day it reopened, I called and they said they were working on it and would call back. After not hearing from them for 2 more weeks I called and the lady said they just didn't have a mechanic with enough experience to work on it. Needless to say, after holding my boat for almost 2 months and never calling to even give me an update. I finally had to get my boat and take it elsewhere. I heard good things about the owner in the past but when he became sick the place went to hell. Not to mention, I filled my gas tank up before bringing it in and it was completely empty when I got it back home. I didn't even bother calling and telling them. Just glad the nightmare is over

name: James Getty
text: Very good people there first time going there to unload boats very helpful about where they unload at. Very polite. Keep up the good work

name: Michele Payne
text: They always take great care of us and our "Happy Bus!!" Awesome RV and Boat storage area. Steve and Dee Dee and their son, are the nicest folks to work with. I'm so sorry I don't remember his name. He is the first one we met on a cold and rainy day.

name: Sylvia Madderra
text: They strive to do the best work!!! Honest people!  Wonderful staff!

name: Haley White
text: My husband and brother dropped their fishing boat off 4 weeks ago. They were told they were backed up and would not be able to begin work on it the week they dropped It off. They said that was fine and understood. However, It has now been 4 full weeks, starting on 5 weeks this Monday. The woman who is running the desk and answering the phone was repeatedly rude to them when they were calling each week for an update. She also never gave her name as a point of contact, hence why I am saying "the woman answering the phone". We understand that businesses can get backed up but to go one whole month without any estimation timeframe of when they will begin work is unacceptable. We did not mind waiting, we just wanted some form of expected time frame. Finally, today we called and said we would just pick the boat up since they have yet to begin any work and my husband/brother have not been able to fish since September 1st. When we asked "the woman" if they would put the boat up front so we could easily pick It up. She replied, "there are no techs working on Saturday and you can just pull in and find it." We are honest people and would never touch another person's boat, however just want you all to know that they just let people in and roam around the lot where other boats are kept. Would not recommend this place of business.

name: C Ray Marilu S Beasley
text: Boat repair. Good job. Took awhile.

name: Brad Price
text: The absolute best in the business

name: ElectroLuxe Tattoo
text: I have been a client of this shop for 15+ years. I’ve pulled my boat from 100’s of miles away to have them work on it, service it and maintain it. I’ve purchased a couple boats from them and they are top notch. Steve and Dee Dee are great people to deal with.

name: Peggy Sanders
text: Had our boat over a month. Kept saying more things needed. Finally got boat back after paying out 1700.00.  They broke the frame on our bimini top which ended up ripping it. Ordered another one from another company. Took the boat out. The boat used excessive gas. Took it out again yesterday and it quit running. Had to be towed in. Having a repair tech coming to the marina to see what is wrong with it. This is the worst company ever. I am going to be contacting Better Business Bureau.

name: Matthew Hughes
text: Talk about going the extra mile!  After calling Mike on a Thursday during the busiest time of the year, he told me that he’d work me in so I could fish that weekend. He later called and told me to bring in my boat late Friday afternoon. He and his guys worked on my boat until 8 pm on a Friday night, fixed the electrical problem, and got me back on the water!  Excellent service at a very fair price.

name: Jamie Summers
text: Mike was a savior! We called on a Saturday after our motors wouldn’t start. Let us drop it off later that day, fixed all the issues quickly and we were able to pick it up on Friday before the weekend!  He was professional and his prices were great. If you have boat issues call Mike.

name: Morocka Bledsoe
text: Mr. Mike is the best. I called him very frustrated because the local shops were to busy for me. Mr. Mike listen to my problem and instantly told me what my problem was. Not only did he diagnose my problem over the phone, but he patiently walked my husband through fixing our problem. I am a forever customer of Mr. Mike, even if I have to bring boat from Phenix City to Dothan. Thank you so much Mr. Mike, you have made a girl in love with her boat so happy.

name: Susie Bradshaw
text: Mr. Mike is our hero!! He fixed our problem over the phone without even looking at the boat. He made a day that looked very bleak fun and memorable for our family. We will be using him for all of our boat needs!

name: Robert Watson
text: Mike is a gem and was a Godsend for me. I do not know anything about boats, but Mike fixed my party barge that had been sitting up for years in under 12 hours. He does professional work at rock bottom prices. I highly recommend Mike's Mobile Marine for all your boating repair needs.

name: Denmark Frank
text: Great experience! A little time consuming, but its worth the wait! He knows what he is doing!

name: Louie Molnar
text: Won't take anything to him again .said he did all this to my motor and did nothing.i had to clean my tank out.he talks a good game but does nothing.very dissatisfied

name: Kaci Robinson
text: Mr. Mike was absolutely WONDERFUL!  He not only fixed my fuel pump on my boat, but he also worked on my lights that I mentioned when we were discussing my fuel pump.  He also kept me informed every step of the way.  Not only did he work on my lights, he apologized for taking an extra hour fixing MY boat on a SATURDAY!!! Most businesses don't work on the weekend! This was absolutely the BEST encounter I have had while trying to have my boat repaired!  I will ONLY take my boat to his shop from this point forward.  And I STRONGLY recommend you do the same!  Thanks soo much!!

resp.text: Glad to help you Kaci. We were happy to be able to help you to enjoy the time that you have off from the craziness of the hospital. Feel free to call with any problems.

text:
Clark and Amanda are great.  Great service, quick turnaround and very reasonable on prices.

My son is on high school fishing team...we were having problems on the water, called Clark.. he walked me through the problem and got us back to fishing.

Later on I had a problem with the lower unit.  Clark and Amanda helped me through the whole process of dealing with the insurance company.

Can't say enough about their service and work. I recommend them to anyone.

text: My 1 star rating is truly overrated for this Owner and his operation.. Money was tight so I made sure to specify to call me if it turns out looking like it will be over $200. Not only did he call back weeks after he said it would be done and no communication on what the plan was and expected cost, it was a good bit over the $200 mark, the lower unit was leaking oil now, and it didn't run much better than it did before. When I showed up to see the leaking lower unit and the bill I addressed the first two issues with Wayne. At which time he proceeded to demand his money (in cash) and then proceeded to cuss me out and demanded that I leave and to not come back. Not that the last part of his beligerent rant had to even be said because I for da$# sure will never spend another dime at this crooked and questionably legal sad excuse for a "business", and I HIGHLY advise others to heed this warning and stay far away. Unless of course you like completely wasting you hard earned money.

Claimed they tried to call him and couldn’t get him. We had no missed calls or no messages on our answering machine from them.  They said they would call the next day and leave a message letting us know when they would get another boat in. AGAIN no call or message from them. He went by and asked them did the boat come in and then they sold it after getting it in. They said yes. My husband asked for his money back and left. That is not the way to do business. Will not be going back to them. We will be doing business with someone that keeps their word not L and L Marine.

name: Dennis Gilliam
text: Bought a PWC from my neighbor knowing it had taken on a lot of water. I tried to piddle with it but decided that I needed to let an expert handle it since water had gotten in the motor. I had some bad luck with previous PWC mechanics in the area so I was apprehensive. Fred at Advanced Watercraft took it in and diagnosed several issues. It was back running in a week. Me and my kids took it out the day we picked it up and by the end of the day it had taken on water again. WAIT! I know it sounds like they didn't fix it, but I took it back to Fred and AW- he was apologetic and accommodating. Turns out in addition to the items he had fixed, a previous mechanic had routed some water lines incorrectly and caused an additional water issue. Although it was not his fault, Fred insisted that he would fix the boat and he did it at no charge. This type of commitment to service is rare these days. Advanced Watercraft and Fred have earned my business as long as I own a PWC. I strongly recommend this company!

resp.text: Thanks for your review!  We pride ourselves on quality work.

text: If you are looking for a boat I highly recommend Skiers Marine!!  I was having a hard time getting to a Marina to buy a boat because they all close at 5pm and I work until 5.  Jeremy called me and asked if I wanted to come look at a boat. I told him yes but I didn’t get off work until about 4:45.  Jeremy, my salesman said “Mr. Morgan, the dealership closes at 5, but if you want to look at a boat I will stay until 7 or 8 if that is what it takes.”  I went that day and we stayed until about 6pm and when I left I had a down payment on a boat. The boat was actually in Athens where it had snowed the night before. Jeremy had them bring that boat to Skiers Marine off hwy 280 the next day!  I went in on a Thursday and had the boat in my driveway Saturday!  5/5 on the dealership. 5/5 on the price and 5/5 on Jeremy my salesman. Go see them even if you have a long drive, you will NOT BE DISAPPOINTED!!

text:
Good morning, Mr. Tyler and All of Skiers Marine!

We want to let you know how impressive your company was at the 2019 Birmingham boat show. Besides your line of superior products, you had quite the staff members there who all were knowledgeable in unique ways. Nick Morris was the first person to approach us and we were more than impressed with his easy, friendly demeanor and willingness to explore our wants in a new boat.  He spent time with us, but also gave us space to look around and gather thoughts.  That casual attitude of salesmanship is quite rare.  He knew tons of details about the Supra. Chad and the other guys were also so friendly & helpful with boat and purchase details. We understood immediately that we were buying a choice in a boat dealer and felt extremely comfortable that Skiers Marine was the number one choice.

This was a large purchase and we did not take it lightly, but the Supra quality coupled with Skiers Marine quality and reputation made this new boat purchase an easy decision.

Thank you for being at the boat show and all of the awesome incentives.  My family looks forward to boat season and sharing our Skiers experiences with folks around Birmingham and Smith Lake!

name: Joe Couvillion
text:
My wife and I just purchased a new MasterCraft X-10 from Rett Tyler at Skiers Marine for our family. We couldn't be happier. He knows his stuff and really went above and beyond what I would think anyone should do.  No pressure to buy and he let our 3 little kids climb all over his super nice boats without shedding one tear- while we deliberated over which boat to get.  After several weeks and my slow decision making process -  He drove to pick up the boat - drove to our lake to deliver it and then rode around with us for over 3 hours making sure we were comfortable. I think we had to kick him out of the boat bc we knew that he had an hour and a half drive back home.
Absolutely happy!  And I think their team was just as excited about the boat as we were.

name: Bob Asmar
text:
We recently purchased a 2013 MasterCraft X55 from the Athens, Alabama dealership and it was a wonderful experience.  Kit Barnes was, by far, the best sales person that I have every worked with.  After 20 years of experience with I/Os and a desire to wake surf, we decided to look into purchasing an inboard/tow boat.  Our requirements were unique, in that we wanted a tow boat that was in the 25 foot length, had a large open bow area and yet could also provide a decent wave for surfing.  During my research, it seemed that a Mastercraft X55 was about the only boat that could potentially meet our needs.  I found a few X55’s of interest on Boattrader, sent inquiries out, and Kit was the first to respond (within a day or two).  He later followed up with a phone call to better understand our situation and he even offered advice on different models and brands.  I was very impressed that he expressed interest in helping us find a boat that best matched our needs and really gave me a crash course on the different models of inboards.  The biggest thing is that he really worked with us on the X55, since I knew that we had to stay in a larger model to meet our family’s requirements.  Kit was the only person that was willing to work with us to see if we could configure the X55 to produce a nice wake for surfing.  The test drive went great and with a few adjustments, Kit had the boat configured to make a nice wake for surfing.

We really appreciate the time that Kit spent with us in answering all of our questions and educating us on the Mastercraft X55.  We proceeded to purchase the boat and are also very happy with the ongoing support and service that Skier’s Marine provides to us. The Athens staff made our buying experience great.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words and for allowing us to serve you!

name: Advanced Orthodontics
text: Great customer service... they will take care of your boat..

name: kimberly mcleod
text: My family recently purchased a boat from Skiiers Marine (April, 2016). Since we had never owned a boat before, we were very apprehensive and nervous about this process. We met with multiple dealers to get a feel for what we wanted and what we could afford. Skiers Marine provided us first class customer service and was by and far the most knowledgeable and down to earth. The owner, Rhett went above and beyond anything we would ask for in this process. For instance, he brought the boat from Birmingham to our friend's neighborhood on Lake Martin so that we could demo it. He spent a couple of hours with me, my wife, and my three little boys demonstrating the boat. Once we decided that we wanted the boat, the purchase process was straight forward and simple. We live in Northern Atlanta. I expected to take a day off of work to drive to Birmingham and pick up the boat. When the boat was prepared and detailed, Rhett called and let me know the day that HE could deliver it! Rhett drove to Atlanta, delivered the boat, and taught me how to put the boat in and out of the water. Yesterday, I arrived home to a package from Skiiers marine. I opened up the box and found two life jackets! Thank you Rhett and Skiiersmarine for taking care of us through this process. If you are buying a boat for the first time (or 2nd or 3rd time), I would highly recommend Rhett and Skiers marine.

text:
After months of searching for our first family boat, I found a used MasterCraft at Skier's Marine.  Living in Minnesota, and not being able to see the boat in person before purchase, Rett was more than accommodating in answering the numerous questions I had before committing to the purchase. He was kind enough to offer to have the boat brought to the Athens store to knock a few hours off of our drive.  The day we picked up the boat, Chad spent a few hours making sure I was familiar with the boat on the water.  2,000 miles and a memorable road trip with my son later, we have the boat back in MN.  Rett and Chad truly care about their customer's experience. I wouldn't  hesitate to drive 2,000 miles again to buy another boat from Skier's Marine in the future. Thank you.

The Case Family

name: Michael Snowden
text: What a refreshing  experience I had at Powersports Service Center. I had a horrible experience down the street at a large dealer who kept my Honda Rancher for two months the first time to replace the carburetor and flush the fuel tank. After I finally picked it up I took off to Ohio on a week long hunting trip only to have it ruined by a carburetor that wasn’t installed properly. Matter of fact the 4 bolts that attach the carburetor were barely  finger tight causing fuel to leak into my air filter chamber. I came home and took it back for another 6 to 8 weeks and had to go sit in the waiting room to have someone actually work on my unit.   A week later after finally picking up my Rancher it wouldn’t crank. A friend told me about Powersports Service Center and  Chuck and the team were amazing. My unit was fixed in three days and the real problem was found and corrected immediately. My Rancher runs perfectly now cranking with the slightest touch of the starter. Powersports Service Center will be the only people who ever  work on my equipment from now on. Oh yeah, the price was very reasonable to top it off. Thank you Chuck!!!

resp.text: Thank you so much. Glad we could resolve your issue.

name: Nathina Greco
text: I see all the reviews are over 2 years ago, please allow me to update you with a current review. I WILL SUPPLY PHOTOS AND AUDIO OF OUR CONVERSATIONS( from when I picked it up) TO PROVE EVERYTHING STATED HERE IS TRUE! I found Trey(the owner) via Facebook, I always do my research. I saw these reviews, and decided to give him a call, it was a week before memorial day weekend. I can provide all call logs, I told him I have an RV that has a lighting issue that I need checked. Considering I am a first time owner he said it may be a simple fix. I said great when may I drop it by? He said he is backed up and it would really help him out a lot if I could bring it by that Tuesday, I told him that sounds great. He asked that I send him my address and the issues via text before hand. I did. I had to work late and had my cousin drop it off. Please see the photos of our texts. I told him a million times DO NOT BUY ANYTHING for the RV I ONLY want a diagnosis. He took a week, and ended up purchasing: -LP for the RV, Checking the outside, HE BROKE the generator and told me that it stopped working. He even said on audio, it was working when you dropped it off. HE broke the battery disconnect again which was working when I dropped it off. When I went to pick it up he kept repeating how he put me in front of other projects and he needs more time. I explained how he told  me to bring it in on that day because he was behind the previous week. He said well ,.... this that...ect Please see the itemized bill of the charges and work he tried to charge me for that I specifically asked him not to do. I have no doubt he is good at working on more commercial projects,but to try and take advantage of  smaller projects is just not good business. I found another company I would recommend to anyone else who is looking for help, If you drive to him he will diagnose for free and walk the entire vehicle with you! It's Deitz Mobile RV. He does have a few different businesses so his response may be slow, but at least he is honest and up front about everything!

text: I have had boats for 40+ years. The service I received exceeded my expectations. There were a total of eight different problems or concerns  with the boat. The staff were very knowledgeable about the boat and the problems I was experiencing. The technician (20+ years experience) explained what and how the repair each of problem would be done. I brought the boat in and picked it up the next day. Based on my prior experience with boat repairs,  I expected to wait one to four weeks. The technician told me in detail what was done which included an overall inspection of the boat. He provided valuable information and advice for care, maintenance, and running the boat. Needless to say, I am totally confident in having all future maintenance and repairs done by this shop.

name: John Doss
text:
Took my boat/ motor in for repairs wasn’t running right. Had been running strong. They thoroughly checked it out. Wasn’t cheap. They showed me the compression and said it wasn’t worth repairing. Wanted to sell me a new motor. That didn’t sound right 330 hrs on the Yamaha 250 2stroke and was strong as heck before. Went on the hull truth blog site put the question out about the compression and what this shop said. The general reply was to run away from that shop was nothing wrong with the compression. They (hull truth) gave great detail how the lower pistons come built with different compression and reasons. I asked mechanic at gulf coast and he got defensive about what I read on hull truth.  Took it to colonial outboard repair in daphne, they fixed! it same motor, running great. I waited months to post review to be sure motor didn’t fail after all. Be very cautious you can see the post on hull truth under Yamaha 250 ox66 compression issue.
Update: second season, motor still running strong 5000 rpm 45mph on a 25’ boat.

text:
I just bought a Sea Chaser 23LX from the Foley Store.  I had a great experience, and have nothing but good things to say about Gulf Coast Boating Centers.  The salesman, Blair, was not at all pushy but at the same time he was always available to answer any questions I had.  This was my first time to buy a new boat and I had a lot of questions.  Blair always responded quickly to all my calls, texts, and emails.
The mechanic, Buddy, is fantastic.  He spent two hours with me on the day I picked the boat up going over everything from bow to stern.  He did an excellent job installing all the extras: ipilot, simrad, ski tow bar, etc... It was very apparent to me that the team at Gulf Coast Boating Centers takes a lot of pride in their work and are dedicated to taking care of their customers.

The other more serious problems I had brought it in for we’re also repaired. this is the same outboard motor that another Yamaha Mechanic on 59 Summerdale told me wasn’t worth repairing and I should buy a new motor  Colonial put life back into this motor for years more use. text: These guys are liars and crooks!!!  I sent in a request a request on 5/19/18 to Daivd at outboard repair and salvage for him to honor a receipt for a 200 hp Mercury outboard motor. I had problems with it from day one.  They kept it for over a month and still wasn't fixed. I took it to Steel Creek Marine who is a certified Mercury outboard repair dealer.   They told me that it was not a 200 hp motor but a 150 hp. Big difference.  THAT'S FRAUD. He also said it had major problems and need to be rebuilt.  I have a written statement of the inspection.  So I spoke to David of Outboard Repair and Salvage.  He stated he would replace it.  I dropped of my boat to get the new motor exchanged.   I asked him to please have it fixed by the end of the week.  I called on that Friday and he said he was looking for one.  Then I called several times to see if the boat was ready but I got no answer.  I finally got someone to pic up on Friday 6/30/18. TWO WEEKS LATER!! They said David would have to call me back. He called back and left 2 messages. 1 saying he was still looking for a motor. Another saying that he found one and would have it ready by Monday which was 7/2. I have the recorded messages.  I called to check on it and the secretary now says it will be another week.  Unfortunately I have waited and waited and waited.  ITS NOW 7/21.  There seemes no concern in fixing this problem in a timely manner. I have lost time, money, vacation waiting for this problem to be corrected. I have missed 2 fishing rodeos that tickets were naught for including the Dauphin Island Deep Sea Fishing Rodeo. I have paid for not just tickets for the event but also for my brother I have not seen in 3 years way to get here to fish with him and my dad.  They dont seem to care the fraudulently sold me a wrong motor, that wasn't working either, nor trying to fix the problem in an expedient manner.

name: Cory McCreary
text:
We really enjoyed our two week stay here! Friendly tenants and staff. Quiet at night and spacious, gravel spots. Every site has a fire pit and picnic table. The community areas are great even though they removed the game room due to a fire. Bathrooms and showers are remodeled and clean. The laundry room is in need of an update but there are many  laundromats nearby if needed. Unfortunately, the WiFi is too weak to even connect to. Despite that, we would definitely stay here again.

Just to note, it IS next door to a recycling plant but the noise was not bothersome to us. Also just to be aware, there are factories across the river that sound alarms on Mondays that could be mistaken for emergency alerts but are not.

*** Because the WiFi issue is out of their control, I updated my review to 5 stars instead of 4.

resp.text: Thank you for your generous review.  The laundry room is currently being updated with the addition of more machines.  And yes, we despise the internet issue ourselves.  Unfortunately, we're located in a "non-growth area", so getting service is not possible, or fiscally not viable for our small business.  We're hoping we can get Starlink SOON!

text: Very impressed with all the improvements done at Jays! So nice!

name: Jessica Parker
text: We stayed here 6 nights and had no internet the entire time. The lady at checkin stated that the company who had contracted to put internet and cable in had reneged on the work. Price per night should reflect lack of amenities stated on website. There is no clubhouse because the main office burned down and they converted the clubhouse into their main office. Neighboring noise from recycling plant during the day was annoying but tolerable. We felt like the price per night should have been between $30-$40 per night compared to other parks we have stayed in. Lake is beautiful and we enjoyed walking along the waters edge.

The campground is clean with amazing views of the Tennessee River. Yes there are lots of full time campers but everyone is respectful and it's quiet at night. And the Sunsets are incredible.
We look forward to going back to one of our Homes away from Home.

text:
we had a great campsite, number 14. Water front and great view. Staff are all great. We did go thru tornado sirens and loud speakers saying to take shelter but I felt there was no place to go. We saw some folks around the bathhouse, but I doubt that would protect much.
The industrial complexes around us were 24/7 noise but inside we did not mind too much.  The paved road into the camp had huge dips and then also speed bumps, which really rocked the RV and the one near the road was so deep we bottomed out the hitch.

name: Ruben Moralez
text: Overall this was a nice place to stay, recent upgrades were done to the road and bath houses. The pool was added but like every downside I’m going to mention, you have to pay to get your key pass and be sure not to loose it! The rent is supposed to be set but you’re always charged extra ALWAYS. I ended up paying 100 more every month because I went over my electricity supposedly. Other then paying more every month I’d say it wasn’t a bad stay the management is friendly for the most part I never had any issues with them. The spots are extremely tight and you can pretty much hear everything your neighbor is doing. There are loud noises from the plants around the park especially on the weekends.

resp.text:
Thank you, Ruben, for your reply.  It allows us to provide information to future guests.   I'd like to respond to your "downsides".

Yes, we collect a $20 deposit on the "key pass" to the pool, which is similar to a hotel key to provide safe passageway into the pool for authorized users.  What you failed to mention is that you get that $20 back when you return the key, so you're not out any money.

Secondly, the sites are metered, and tenants are charged .16/kWh for power usage, and one is invoiced anything usage over the $50 allowance.  Anyone is welcomed to monitor their usage by taking note of the meter reading.  It's certainly unfair for a 22' unit to have to pay a higher rent to cover the usage of a 42' unit which has 2 or 3 air conditioner units, therefore, we keep all things even by giving each monthly guest a $50 allowance toward their power.  How they use it is up to the tenant.  You were also here during the summer months when temperatures were extremely high and often record-setting, so yes, you would more than likely have a higher power usage to keep the camper cool.

Thirdly, the site you were on is one of our smaller and cheaper sites.  We have larger sites as well.

Lastly, we are located next to a scrap yard, and they do move scrap around 6 days a week.  Their weekend noise is no different than during the week.  You must have just been off on the weekends to hear it.

And yes, we're continuing to make improvements on the property, including the addition of 21 more sites so we may welcome more guests!

name: Gloria Schulte
text: Nice place. Bathrooms and showers are very clean. Pool is great. Not in great neighborhood but park is gated. Small but you can tell owners try to keep it maintained.

resp.text: Thank you, Gloria. I’d like to clarify. please. The area is safe, it’s just in an industrial area. Safe travels!

name: Carlton Daggett
text: Highly recommend. Friendly staff, Nice pool, Water front Views. No problems with tenants here. I have been staying here for over a month now.

resp.text: Thank you, Carlton!  We are continuing to make improvements, so for you to take the time to post something positive is appreciated!

name: Calista Hans
text: Great customer service! We were met by very friendly Jay Landings greeters as soon as we pulled into the marina who were helpful with all of our questions and getting us unpacked and settled in our boat for a long weekend stay. They also gave us a list of fun things to do and see along the Tennessee River. Bathrooms and facilities were clean and well-lit, and LOTS of great fishing!! We definitely plan on coming back!!

name: Julie Ryan
text:
It's a beautiful places with a lot of recent upgrades. Very nicely recently renovated shower suites, nice pool, beautiful fire pit areas to watch the sunset.

The downsides are that the spots (especially the pullthroughs)are really small and cramped, the road into and through the campground while recently repaved is very narrow, the wifi is terrible, and the bugs are aplenty. We also noticed trash buildup in our sewage receptacle and broken glass all around our site.

Based on older reviews, it appears they are taking steps to really improve the park and we hope that now that they've done some major things they'll take a look at the small things.

We'd also suggest they update their website with correct pricing as the price we were charged was about 25% higher than what their website quotes.

text: We stayed the Memorial Day weekend here. We drove from Florida. Elizabeth and Joel were amazing hosts. They were extremely helpful and friendly. The park is well maintained. The bathrooms were clean. The price is right and the view was amazing. Definitely will be returning for the 41st Annual Hot Air Balloon Festival and will stay at Jay's Landing and Marina. I already have my reservation made.

name: Sher Keb
text:
Very similar to roughing it by the river with electric, water and sewer.

Regardless of anything (State or personal emergencies), reservations not cancelled 7 days in advance are not refundable where other campgrounds did give us a refund due to a state declared emergency. On May 27, 2018 when “The governors of Alabama, Florida and Mississippi declared a state of emergency in their states as Subtropical Storm Alberto spread north and west.
As for a overall review of Jay’s Landing in Decatur Alabama, see below:

Con’s:
-Interface with management done only by phone. Reservation, check-in & problem resolution.
-400 feet of very pot holed narrow driveway. Many potholes in little bit of asphalt then much more potholes in the more clay than gravel drive. (Very muddy when it rains)
-More long term “campers” in the park then recreational RV campers
-Paper litter, cigarette butts, nut & bolts, metal scraps found on camp sites.
-Bathroom & shower building is far from camping sites
-Sites are close to each other
-No fishing allowed.

Pro’s
- 2 unisex bathrooms & showers were clean
-Site utilities (electric, water & sewer) are convenient. Electric 30 amp circuit showed good connection and grounding.
-Reservation email sent with a site map document with your site.
-Picnic tables at each site.
-Nice river view
'Common area gazebo with a fire pit and a little playground.

Has the makings of a nice RV park… Someday

resp.text: We are trying!  Thank you for noticing and making a comment!!!  We hope to be complete by late Spring next year.

name: D Vanloh
text: We love Jay Landings Marina.  My wife and I spend a weekend there every summer and the owners are some of the most hospitable and friendly people we've ever met.  Our kids love the game areas they have almost as much as they love the chickens!  We will be back again soon!

name: matt chitwood racing
text: Worst RV campground we been to! We turned around and forfeited our money. But.... it is surrounded by metal scrap yards, if you like that kind of area.

resp.text: I am sorry you did not find us to your standards.

name: April Scott
text: Beautiful environment!

name: Mary Novak
text: Great views, clean restrooms! The owners are wonderful and so helpful.  The views are great and I really loved the fire pit and gazebo.  We will definately stay there again on our way to and from Gulf Shores.

name: Donna Roy
text: I can't say enough good things about Jay's landing and RV park. I've had a wonderful time here. Elizabeth and Joel go out of their way to make you feel welcome. I have already booked my site for next Memorial day weekend.

name: Chris dillbeck
text: Stayed for 2 nights with family.   This is in the middle of an industrial complex and felt like it is in a run down part of town.  Factory noise all the time.   The metal recycling yard is across the road.   Bathrooms are far away and pretty dirty.  Not to far from interstate.  Many long term campers.  Definantly not worth the amount we paid.  We stayed in site 14 on the water.

name: Steve K
text: Easy access to US-72 and nice location, especially if you have a boat and are looking for access to the river or an overnight stop between Atlanta and Memphis. The Wi-Fi seemed fine, and the laundry facilities were clean (although we didn't use them). The only recommendation is that they fill in some of the potholes on the drive in, as it's a little rough.

name: Nancy Brown
text:
Shower area could have been cleaner
Park and view on general was a nice view and peaceful setting.
Staff was very friendly and nice and kid friendly.

resp.text: Please come back!  Yes, our bath house was in a “low standard” condition, but they have undergone renovation and are now stunning!!!

name: Renee Conway
text: We went with all intentions of only staying a week to 10 days and enjoyed the camp site so well that we stayed for a month. Love the owners and employees are all so helpful and care about their property

name: Jose Noway
text: Might as well stay in a crackhouse. This place is just as dirty and has similar amenities. Only difference is the price.

resp.text:
Mr. Stimpson, are you the owner of “The Other Woman”?  I’m not aware of another John/Jon Stimpson.

Can you expound on what’s “dirty”?  If you’re referencing dusty, you are absolutely correct in referencing our previous state. However, we are undergoing major improvements and paving, which you wouldn’t know about since you haven’t been on the property nor a tenant in a year or so.

If this isn’t the same Mr. Stimpson, then please accept my apology, and will you further explain?

name: Faye Holt
text: Sun set at Jay's landing

name: Dustin Pannell
text: Good place nice ppl working nights very respectful... they tryed not doing thing around my camper while I was sleeping waited for me to get up and go to work first!!!!!

name: Thomas Schmelzle
text: Was a decent place to stay for a night.

resp.text: Thank you.

name: Ronald Wojtylko
text: Tight RV spaces, lousy internet.  Worst thing nay be that it is right next to SA recycling so at 6 am, the noise level gets quite high.  Place is a construction worker cash grab.

resp.text: Yes; some spaces are tight, but not all.  Yes, there is a recycling plant next door, and there are times when it is very noisy.  It makes me sad that you say we are a "construction worker cash grab".  We are in business to provide a nice place for "construction worker(s)", and when I have to turn someone down because we are full due to all of the work in the area, we feel badly that we cannot provide a safe environment for such wonderful tenants.  You haven't been here in awhile.  Please come back.  We are in the middle of major property improvements, and we'd like to think that you'd enjoy your next stay.

name: chris corso
text: We stayed for a night coming home from vacation and it was wonderful.  The facilities were very clean and the owners (who took over a few years back) keep the place ship shape and very pleasant.  This rv park/marina is surrounded by a lot of industry  but, this did not keep us from enjoying ourselves in the time we were there.  We had a great time checking out the giant old boats, chickens, playing basketball, and playing with the giant chess set and jenga.  This is not a traditional rv park with wooded surroundings, but we thought it was just great, and if we had brought our boat or fishing poles, we would have loved it even more as it is surrounded on 2 sides by water.  Recommend.

name: Trish Juaire
text: Nice place. Clean and respectable

name: Spencer Campbell
text: Come up one day and got a great offer

resp.text: Thanks!

name: Melissa Durgin
text: Owners are very nice. Close to everything.

name: Jon Stimpson
text: Very dirty and spartan. Expensive considering the condition.

resp.text: You should revisit to see the improvements.

name: Charles Dollar
text: Yea,live in a marina,my kinda place

resp.text: Thanks, Charles!  It's coming along with more to come!

name: Brandon Chase
text: Rates high compared to other rv parks close by.

name: john shallenberger
text: Nice place , nice people

name: April H.
text: Took us a long time to get there just to find it was not there... Didn't call to find out anything just went on to our other stops...

name: Joey DeBlanc
text: I live just outside Nashville TN and on a recommendation from some old guy that lives on lake Guntersville, I drug my boat to Browns Outboard in Glenco AL for what I thought was a fuel issue.  It turned out to be a blown #3 cylinder.   Thanks to covid and manufacturer slow downs, it took a few months to get my late model Mercury parts in.  I wore Jeremy out with constant phone calls asking about the status of my boat.  I only got short with him once, but thankfully, he was nothing but professional.  It turns out that my engine was suffering from the time I purchased it used, from a half rate mechanic in Louisiana.   The Owner, Lee, went through my motor with a fine tooth comb!  They went above and beyond fixing her up so that when I picked her up, there would be NO issues.  I'm about half way through the rebuild break-in period and I am ecstatic!  It's like a brand new engine!  I can't wait to open her up and see what she'll really do!.  Job well done boys!!!  I'll make that 3 hour drag anytime to let Brown's Outboard do it right!  Don't bother messing around with anybody else!

name: Greg Tucker
text: The best boat mechanics in alabama

name: Jonathan Hill
text: They are legit , are the only ones that I have found that actually do what they say and are easy enough on the wallet.

name: Katherine Haywood
text: They have been working on my boat for the past 5 years and I couldn't ask for better work! I highly recommend this business!

name: Johnny Peterman
text: Great folks!

name: Willis Jennings
text: Very respectful and nice, service is awesome & willing to work with you

name: Smitty Jays
text: They are really slow at what they do..m.mmm

name: Tom Mclemore
text:
By far best outboard shop in North Alabama. Nobody but Lee and his team will work on my boats.
Known the family for years and great service.

name: Janice Wall
text: Service was Great very nice people

name: Johnny Butler
text: Well. When i dropped my boat off i agreed to have a specified amount of work done to my 1992 Sea Ray. And for this specified amount of work was a specific amount of pay. Well, the boat wasnt winterized correctly prior to me purchasing. So as a result the freeze plug was out and was leaking water. So i was told in order to replace the freeze plug the motor had to come out of the boat. After pulling the motor and replacing the freeze plug he said he would then put it back together and take the boat and run it at shop to make sure it didnt run hot and if i didnt he would then take it to the river and run it hard to make sure it still didnt run hot. This exact deal was made for a total of $900. I agreed to this. However, he didnt take the motor out for some reason he took the out board off and didnt replace the freeze plug. And said as is i owed him the $900. And he wasnt putting it back together. This has been over 5 months ago. Just for a freeze plug plu. After heated discussions he agreed to put my boat back together and call me when it was finished. I have called mulitple times to only be put on hold and never have they answered after putting me on hold. I feel as though i have no other choice but to pursue this matter legally. I have heard alot of good things about this business but if this is how they do people i would recommend NOT taking your boat needs here.

name: Jason Vaughn
text: Always a great experience!!

name: Robert Duke
text: Good service

name: junk can
text: Having been involved in recreational boating or commercial shipping nearly my whole life of almost 50 years, I can eagerly attest that Nelson Boatyard is a bright spot in the South for commercial and recreational boaters to service their vessels!  The very affordable rates make the location a win to begin with.  The massive capacity of this large and expanding boatyard is another positive, though they graciously made room for me even in the midst of the fallout of Hurricane Sally .  However, perhaps the best aspect of the facility are the brilliant array of professionals associated with it who are able to attend to any matter that one might face.  Though I intended to perform all the work on my boat, I was delighted to find both excellent, generous guidance and reliable, experienced service providers to attend to all my needs that were beyond my own capacity.  I suppose that is to be expected from a business operated by four generations of one family!   I will be gladly returning from Pensacola for routine maintenance every two years!

name: John Lanier
text: Awesome

name: Matt White
text: Very nice and fair people! Great Price for good work!

resp.text: Thanks!

name: Justin Lewis
text: Advanced Marine & Power Systems was the most professional and on-the-ball company I've worked with to install a whole house generator. My family and I searched all over the area and luckily we called Ross and his team knocked it out of the park with the installation, communication, and overall service. If you are in the market for a Kohler Generator, you will be in good hands with Ross and his team. I only wish I lived closer for them to work on our boat!

name: James Cook
text: I recently completed the purchase of a Kohler home standby generator for my primary residence in Pensacola. After attending two home shows, researching all brands of standby generators, and reading as many reviews of local distributors and servicers as I could, I decided that P & D Marine had the best combination of price and service. I can honestly say that from initial meeting to discuss the selection, purchase and installation process, through the setting of the generator and electric service contractor and gas hookup, it was a complete pleasure working with Ross and Travis at P & D.  As part of my research, I had tried last year to work with two different firms and both either did not return my calls, or were no shows for the initial meeting to discuss my electrical standby needs. Save yourself some aggravation if you are shopping for a whole house standby generator and call Ross or Travis. You'll be glad you did!

resp.text:
hi jim, just saw your review. thank you so much for the thoughtful review.
we try really hard to get it right. we are also very appreciative of customers like you and cheral. you both were great to work with. enjoy your peace of mind knowing you have back up power.
thx again , ross and the crew

name: Mike Manosky
text:
I live out of the Orange Beach area and have worked with P & D Marine twice the last 2 years. The first time I had a trailer breakdown traveling to the area for vacation. It was the busy summer months and they were a week out on repairs but they worked me in quickly and saved our vacation.

Recently I brought my boat in to get some routine service and an exhaust repair done while on a trip to the area. Once again, they got me in and out quickly and when they promised and kept me informed while they performed the service work by emailing me pictures.

They are first class operation and I will definitely be back again. Thanks!

resp.text: Mike, thank you for doing business with us! We appreciate the kind words, come back to OBA soon.

name: Mark Cecil
text:
As someone that has spent over 30 years in the automotive equivalent of these guys I can truly say that they are without a doubt the rare few business' that truly understand customer service. They are not the cheapest and they are not the highest. Ross and his crew are the ones you want to use when you may need service after the sale.

I have always thought that the true measure of as service company is when something goes wrong. That has happened to me and Ross and Travis were front and center to turn minor issue into a massive KUDO!!!

Love these guys!!

resp.text: hi mark, we hope all is well with you and your family. thank you so much for the kind words. did you sell the sea ray ? thx again and if you need anything you have our number.

name: Dsve Haynes
text: Great place for boat parts.

name: Charles Tucker
text: Will not work on my boat because it's a 1978 model. My money is green. My boat is in fantastic shape. Asked them to do an engine alignment on a brand new engine, an engine they advertise to work on. I don't understand why a business would have such a policy. This  is a pretty simple task they could have made a   few bucks on. I have done all the hard work of installing the engine.

resp.text: Charles, thank you for the feedback. We are a private business and are entitled to have a policy in place that protects our best interest. We're sorry that we could not do business at this time.

name: Mary Nobles
text: Awesome place to work Owner are family orientated.

name: Craig Austin
text: Awesome staff, easy to deal with, they know there profession for sure!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Craig! We appreciate your business.

name: Elevated Tactics
text: Great group of mechanics. Very family oriented.

resp.text: Thank you for the great feedback!

name: Mark Jackson
text: I've used them for multiple years and have always been extremely satisfied.  Quick turnaround, good work, honest and upfront.

resp.text: Thank you for your business Mark, we appreciate your feedback!

name: Dee Marie Fisher
text:
P& D Marine Services..... we took our boat over for major repairs last year, promised it would take 4 weeks and finally received it back a little over 8 weeks later at a much higher cost.  Their customer service was terrible and they haven't heard of "under promise and over deliver" on their service!

This year we had the generator they installed last year quit working.... they said "oh, bring it over and we'll get to it".  Gee, after experiencing last year's customer service, we asked that they either give absolute guarantee of repair time or preferably that they come over to Perdido Key to repair at our marina slip.

No, they couldn't give a guarantee and they no longer provide service to Perdido Key!  This answer was less than 4 weeks ago..... and today they are servicing a boat on our dock!

Will never use them and definitely not refer them to anyone!

resp.text:
Dee, we regret to find out that you had such a bad experience with us. Unfortunately, we are obligated to comply with all Kohler policies in order to maintain our status as an authorized dealer.

Quote from Kohler representative:  "As long as the unit has less than 2000 hours it has full coverage until 7/31/17 and we require that the diagnosis and repair be performed by an authorized dealer or distributor."

name: James Dorgan
text: After bouncing from one marine repair place to another, P & D is now our 'go to' boat repair place for our 22 foot inboard Chaparral.  So many times other places misdiagnosed an issue, or recommended unnecessary repairs, and P & D always gets it right, and gets it fixed the first time.  They are also very quick with repairs, and communicate exactly what is going on.  It is also convenient to the major boat launches in Orange Beach, so you simply drop the boat off with them, even after hours, and they take care of things on the next business day.  Their prices are reasonable for the speed of turnaround, and quality of work product.  I firmly believe too that they are incredibly honest and fair with everything they do.  I highly recommend them for your boat servicing needs. - James Dorgan, Attorney at Law, Fairhope, Alabama

resp.text: Mr. Dorgan, it was a pleasure working for you. Thank you for trusting Advanced to be your go-to service center for your Chaparral.

name: Mike Bishop
text: P&D just swapped out my Mercuriser 454 after it injested water for the second time.  My previous repair service could not find the cause of the water intrusion.  P&D finished the job on time and on budget AND resolved the original problem that the other guys could not find.  Very appreciative of their abilities!

resp.text: Mike, thank you for the kind words, we appreciate your business!

name: Mary Nobles
text: Great service.  Honest and friendly to.

resp.text: Thank you Mary!!

name: Randy Johnson
text: Great people

resp.text: We appreciate it Randy!

name: Kathy Fox
text: Be sure to get a WRITTEN estimate! They gave me a verbal estimate that (apparently) did not include labor, shipping or tax,  very disappointed in the management for not honoring the quoted price.

resp.text: Kathy, sorry to hear that the service wasn't what you expected. Often times an estimate can be for best-case scenarios, not anticipating any unexpected obstacles. But in the boat business, you definitely get what you pay for. Thanks for your feedback.

name: Michael Handley
text: I have no idea why I was there
